[ C ]
  FINANCE, COMMERCE an amount of money that is sent somewhere as payment for something: Complete the membership form and send it to the address below, together with your remittance for the membership fee.
[ U ]
  FINANCE, COMMERCE the act of sending money somewhere as payment for something: remittance of sth The bank permits remittance of dividends to non-resident shareholders. remittance fees/service
remittances [ plural ]
ECONOMICS money that is sent by a foreign worker back to their own country: Immigrants sent $45 billion in remittances to Latin America last year. About 1.5 million Dominicans live in the United States and help the economy by sending remittances back home.
